newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Maastricht Handling may take on cargo handling at Ostend airport.
newsitem.headline: Maastricht Handling may take on cargo handling at Ostend airport.

text.p: Maastricht Handling is looking into the possibilities of taking on a cargo handling role at the Belgian airport of Ostend.

Marco van de Kreeke, joint managing director of the Dutch handling company, which is a 100 percent owned by Maastricht Aachen airport, said that Ostend airport's management team invited the Dutch handling company to investigate handling opportunities at the Belgian airport.
The investigation is in a very early stage and any conflict of interest that may arise between the two regional airports is also being considered, he added.
Currently, just a freight handling role is being looked into, although Maastricht Handling does handle both passenger and cargo aircraft at the southern Dutch airport.
Turkish Airlines, Royal Jordanian and Iberia are amongst its customers.

Commenting on why Ostend had asked a Dutch handling company he said: "In spite of Maastricht's restrictions - only having a 2.5 km runway and a night curfew - we do have a good reputation for handling aircraft."
It is too early to say when a decision will be made but it could be in the next few months, he said.

Belgavia and Sabena carry out handling activities at the Belgian airport at present. But Ostend is experiencing a rapid growth in freight activities, with 1996 seeing a 12.6 percent growth in freight volumes on 1995 levels.
If the plans go ahead, this will be Maastricht Handling's first venture into third-party handling work. -Air Cargo Newsroom Tel+44 171 542 7706 Fax+44 171 542 5017
